qas.question: The CPU is an abbreviation for what?
What 3 parts make up the CPU?

answers.text: The control unit, ALU, and registers

qas.question: CPUs that are constructed on a single integrated circuit are called what?
Since when have CPUs been constructed with a microprocessor?

context: <a1_0>The control unit, ALU, and registers<a1_0/> are collectively known as a <a0_0>central processing unit<a0_0/> (CPU). Early CPUs were composed of many separate components but since the <a3_0>mid-1970s<a3_0/> CPUs have typically been constructed on a single integrated circuit called <a2_0>a microprocessor<a2_0/>.
